stocks.note: *Numbers as of market close on Feb 11th
stocks.news:
Lyft's Rough Ride:

Lyft's (LYFT -16.97%) shares hit a pothole after its revenue miss.

What happened? Competition from companies like Uber (UBER -3.39%), promotional costs, and even weather-related rides.

But between a $1B buyback and new laws making insurance cheaper in California, Lyft hopes to drop costs and lift earnings and revenue by year-end.

King Of The Hill:

When Nike (NKE -1.09%) appointed Eliot Hill as its CEO, the brand was losing ground to competitors like Adidas and Hoka.

‚Ä¢ But Hill is showing that the world runs on Nike, as the brand races towards Europe and Asia after boosting sales in the U.S.

economy.commentary:
Re-writing History:

The deets: The U.S. added 130,000 jobs and unemployment dipped to 4.3% in January.

‚Ä¢ üëç Good news: That's double what economists expected.
‚Ä¢ üëé Not-so-good news: 2025's revised data shows only 181K jobs added all year, down from 584K.

crypto.note: *Numbers as of 4:25 pm ET on Feb 11th
crypto.commentary:
Bitcoin Busts a Move:

The Bitcoin slide continued yesterday. The world's most valuable crypto dipped to around $66,000 per coin, its lowest point since November 2024.

‚Ä¢ It did recover to around $70,000 per coin by the mid parts of the trading day.

Ethereum and Solana also took a hit, as tech investments in general have spooked some investors this year.

real_estate.homebuilder:
Zillow Finally Turns A Profit:

Zillow's (Z -16.54%) Q4 2025 results were mixed:

‚Ä¢ Revenue was up 18% year-over-year, beating expectations.
‚Ä¢ Earnings per share (EPS) was a miss.

Still, the company reported its first profitable year since 2012, but it wasn't enough to stop the drop yesterday.

Every Basis Point Counts:

Mortgage rates staying steady, so borrowers are taking advantage of any way to lower costs.

As a result, both FHA loans and refinance applications increased.

‚Ä¢ Refi applications are 101% higher than they were during the same week one year ago.

Why FHA loans? They are about 0.2% lower than conventional loans.
real_estate.commentary:
As of Thursday, February 12, 2026, the real estate market in the Bay Area‚Äîspecifically Fremont, Alameda County, and Santa Clara County‚Äîis showing distinct signs of softening prices coupled with a rise in inventory, offering a rare window of opportunity for buyers before the spring rush.

Here is the latest news and market data from today and the past weekend.

üìç Fremont Market Update (Focus Area):

‚Ä¢ Latest Trend (Feb 10‚Äì12): The market remains a "Seller's Zone" but is cooling. While still competitive, the frenzy has calmed significantly compared to last year.
‚Ä¢ Prices & Sales:
‚Ä¢ Median Sale Price: $1.17M (Down 2.6% year-over-year).
‚Ä¢ List Price Trends: The median list price this week is hovering around $1.7M.
‚Ä¢ Competition: Homes are selling in approximately 21‚Äì26 days. While "hot" homes still sell in ~9 days, the average time on market has increased by 9 days compared to last year.
‚Ä¢ Recent Sales (This Week & Weekend):
‚Ä¢ Sold Feb 11: 4-bed on Wisteria Dr sold for $2.85M (6% over list).
‚Ä¢ Sold Feb 11: 3-bed on Eggers Cmn sold for $1.13M (8% over list).
‚Ä¢ Sold Feb 9: 2-bed condo on Rothbury Cmn sold for $639k (at list price).
‚Ä¢ New Opportunity: The City of Fremont has a deadline approaching on Friday, Feb 20, 2026, for its "Below Market Price" (BMP) home (a brand-new townhome on Fremont Blvd).

Developing Story - Musician Killed by Deputies (San Leandro/Alameda County):

The biggest story in the East Bay today involves the identification of the man shot and killed by Alameda County Sheriff's deputies earlier this week.

‚Ä¢ Update Today: The victim has been identified as Anthony Anderson, a 40-year-old local Bay Area trumpeter.

Corruption Plea (San Leandro):

Former San Leandro City Councilmember Bryan Azevedo pleaded guilty today/late yesterday to federal corruption charges. This is sending shockwaves through local East Bay politics, as he has agreed to cooperate with federal prosecutors, which could lead to further investigations in the county.
